definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: I beg your pardon , " said Alice very humbly."
The students at the college are passive and respectful .
sentences.chinese: 大学的学生都很规矩恭顺。

sentences.english: It was out of date for Youth to defer to Age.
sentences.chinese: 要青年对老年恭顺，现在是过时了。

sentences.english: Why should I venerate and be ceremonious?
sentences.chinese: 我为什么要恭顺守礼呢？

sentences.english: All rose and meeklyraised their hands.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都站起来，恭顺的高举双手。

sentences.english: He is a humble and submissive servant .
But deferential diplomacy can only get you so far.
sentences.chinese: 但恭顺外交仅能如此而已。

sentences.english: You cannot expect a member of the royal family to bow the knee to an ordinary man.
sentences.chinese: 你不要指望皇室的成员会向平民表现出恭顺。

sentences.english: Afterwards, Shun didn't resent and was still humble to his father and loved his younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 事后舜毫不嫉恨，仍对父亲恭顺，对弟弟慈爱。

sentences.english: We are humble enough to be human in this world.
sentences.chinese: 我们足够谦逊恭顺以至于在世间为人。

sentences.english: She humbly took her seat by the fire and stayed there.
sentences.chinese: 她恭顺地坐在火旁椅子上，呆在那里。

sentences.english: Take care not to offend her. She always smites with the tongue.
sentences.chinese: 他总是恭顺地把他掠到的大部分财物送给她。

definition: variant of 畢恭畢敬|毕恭毕敬[bi4 gong1 bi4 jing4]
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
neither haughty nor humble/neither overbearing nor servile/neither supercilious nor obsequious
